It is traditionally cooked by hanging the duck upside down over a wood-fired stove to roast, resulting in a glossy, caramelized exterior and juicy interior. Accompanied by steamed buns, it is a signature dish of Chinese cuisine.

The visual features include a golden-brown crispy skin with juicy, tender meat, often accompanied by a dark, glossy sauce.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish of roasted duck, often served with crispy skin and juicy meat. It is traditionally cooked by roasting whole ducks over a bed of charcoal until the skin is crispy and the meat is tender. The duck is then sliced and served with a sweet and tangy hoisin sauce, accompanied by pancakes or rice. The crispy skin is a hallmark of this dish, and the rich, savory flavor is a result of the slow roasting process.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish made from roasted duck, typically marinated and served with crispy skin and tender meat, often sliced and accompanied by dipping sauces, typically featuring a sweet and tangy flavor profile, and is known for its crispy skin and juicy meat.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish prepared by roasting whole ducks, typically skin-on and with a layer of fat. It is served sliced, with crispy, caramelized skin and tender, juicy meat, often accompanied by hoisin sauce, pickled vegetables, and pancakes for wrapping.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish consisting of roasted duck with crispy, caramelized skin and juicy meat, typically served with a sweet and sour sauce, often accompanied by a side of pancakes and fresh vegetables.

The dish is characterized by its thin slices of duck meat, dark brown skin, and the distinctive crackling sound when eating.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish consisting of thinly sliced roasted duck served with crispy skin, tender meat, and accompanied by green onions and dipping sauces. It is traditionally cooked by roasting the duck on a vertical spit until the skin is crispy and the meat is juicy. The dish is visually appealing with a golden-brown, crispy outer layer and a succulent interior, garnished with fresh green onions.	<>	Peking Duck, a delicacy, is roasted whole, its skin crispy and charred, with a thin layer of fat under the skin. Served with shredded green onions, it exudes a rich, dark hue, and its savory essence is complemented by a tangy dipping sauce.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish made from roasted duck served with crispy skin, often accompanied by shredded scallions, and a tangy hoisin sauce. It is typically prepared by roasting the duck at high temperatures until the skin is crispy and the meat tender, then sliced and arranged on a plate.

Its appearance features a golden-brown, glossy skin with a crispy, flaky texture, often served with pancakes, scallions, and a sweet hoisin sauce.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish featuring roasted duck with a crispy skin and tender meat, often served with sweet, tangy dipping sauce. It is traditionally cooked by roasting the duck over a charcoal brazier until the skin is perfectly crispy and the meat is succulent.	<>	Peking Duck, a classic Chinese dish, is made from a whole roasted duck, typically skin-on, marinated in a sweet-savory sauce. It is cooked by roasting over a bed of hot coals to achieve a crispy, glazed skin and tender, juicy meat. The dish is served with hoisin sauce, green onion, and pancakes.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish featuring roasted duck, typically marinated in a blend of spices, soy sauce, and sugar, then grilled over high heat, resulting in crispy skin and juicy meat. It is often served with pancakes, sweet bean sauce, and lettuce, making for a flavorful and visually appealing meal.

It is typically served with steamed buns, scallions, and hoisin sauce, and is recognizable by its golden-brown, caramelized skin and the tender, juicy meat.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish featuring roasted duck served with shredded duck skin, often accompanied by a sweet and spicy sauce, typically garnished with fresh vegetables like cabbage and lettuce. The duck is cooked using a method that involves marinating the duck overnight, then roasting it until crispy and flavorful. The exterior is charred, giving it a deep brown, crispy texture, while the interior remains tender.	<>	Peking Duck is characterized by its crispy, roasted duck skin and tender meat, often garnished with sweet-savory sauce. It is typically served with fresh vegetables like bok choy and shredded scallions, making it a flavorful and visually appealing dish.	<>	Peking Duck is a dish featuring sliced roasted duck with a crispy skin and a savory sauce, often served with scallions and a side of steamed buns or vegetables. It is typically cooked by roasting the duck until the skin is crispy and then slicing it into thin pieces. The visual features include a golden-brown, glossy exterior with visible strips of fat, accompanied by a side of steamed vegetables.
